p: In line with the overarching description of sensemaking, research concentrated on the making of sense, the giving of sense and factors associated with sensemaking. Research suggests that it is not just in new complex situations of external origin that sensemaking has benefits, sensemaking in the strategy formation and implementation process has been found to impact corporate reputation and performance (Khan, 2018). Sensemaking in a sustainability transition within the higher education sector was examined by Bien and Sassen ( 2020) identifying discourse strategies, triggers of resistance and determinants in the process of developing sense and giving meaning in conceptualising a sustainable future.
